Legal_Issue: Whether failure to use the trademark 'Fascination' for three years constitutes special circumstances excusing non-use under s. 45 of the Trade-marks Act
Evidence_Assessment: Appellant provided no evidence of when use would resume or specific obstacles preventing use
Burden_of_Proof: On appellant to prove special circumstances justifying non-use
Credibility_Factor: Appellant's claim of economic conditions deemed insufficient without supporting evidence
Legal_Rule: Under s. 45(3), a trademark may be expunged if not used and absence of use is not due to special circumstances beyond the owner's control
Standard_of_Review: Statutory interpretation and application of s. 45 of the Trade-marks Act
Procedural_Issue: Proceedings initiated by Registrar under s. 45; appeal to court
Grounds_for_Claim: Non-use of trademark for three consecutive years
Outcome_on_Merits: Appellant failed to establish special circumstances; claim rejected
Review_Standard: Application of statutory criteria under s. 45(3)
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Proceedings conducted in accordance with statutory process
Key_Evidence_Considered: Economic conditions cited as reason for non-use; lack of evidence on timing or plans for resumed use
Legal_Framework: Trade-marks Act, particularly s. 45 regarding non-use and expungement
Defendant_Response: Economic downturn as justification for non-use
Evidence_Type: Oral and documentary evidence (implied by context)
Outcome: Trademark 'Fascination' expunged; costs awarded to respondent
Authority: Registrar of Trademarks, Court on appeal
Legal_Provision_Cited: s. 45(3) and s. 45 of the Trade-marks Act
Applicable_Process: Ex parte proceedings under s. 45 followed by appeal
Governing_Rule: s. 45(3), Trade-marks Act â€“ non-use and special circumstances
